channel.title: TrayIcon mouse listener

item.title: TrayIcon mouse listener
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

I assume you can’t correct that. The Javadocs states (if you havn’t already read there):

Note: The MOUSE_ENTERED and MOUSE_EXITED mouse events are not supported.

Read full topic

item.title: TrayIcon mouse listener
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

Ollie:

how does she know where the icon will be? it will change depending on what program you have loaded up and on your screen resolution.

mouseMoved doesn’t return screen coordinates, it returns component coordinates, so check if there is a (-1, -1) event sent

Read full topic

item.title: TrayIcon mouse listener
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:3, topic:381756”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=477566.msg3494525#msg3494525 date=1297204261]
maybe you cant
[/quote]
but it does fire the MouseMoved event with the MouseMotionListener.[/quote]

if it sends out the mouseMoved, check if the bounds are within the icon

item.title: TrayIcon mouse listener
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

When I add a MouseListener to a TrayIcon the MouseEnter and MouseExit events are never fired, How can I correct this?

         MouseListener mouseListener = new MouseListener() {

        public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e) {
            System.out.println("Tray Icon - Mouse clicked!");
        }

        public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e) {
            System.out.println("Tray Icon - Mouse entered!");
        }

        public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e) {
            System.out.println("Tray Icon - Mouse exited!");
        }

        public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {
            System.out.println("Tray Icon - Mouse pressed!");
        }

        public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {
            System.out.println("Tray Icon - Mouse released!");
        }
    };
    icon.addMouseListener(mouseListener);

Read full topic
